Reviews.Title: Nice 12v TV
Reviews.Author: Trent
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for use in the fish house.  I wanted something I could run directly off of 12v as to minimize the draw on the battery (didn't want to have to rely on a DC converter).  I had never heard of the brand prior to research so was a little skeptical but went for it anyways.Picture Quality: 4/5The picture quality is pretty good, I have no complaints in that area.  I read others that complained about the black levels but to be honest this hasn't been an issue for me at all, and I consider myself fairly picky.  I have used both a UHF antenna and cable and both look very nice on this TV.  Colors are bright and image is very crisp.  I used this as a computer monitor as well and the picture also looked more than satisfactory.Sound Quality: 2/5Sound quality is pretty poor in my opinion.  There is absolutely zero bass and sounds a bit tin can like.  If I was using this as my primary television I would immediately invest in some form of external speaker.  Because my TV's purpose is portability (hence the 12v) and using in a fish house I'm not overly concerned with the sound quality.  While the sound is barely adequate I can't honestly give more than 2 out of 5 for sound though, it just isn't' there.  I suspect this may have something to do with trying to minimize power consumption by using small speakers that don't draw much juice.Power Consumption: 5/5I have been very impressed with how long I can run this TV straight off a 12v battery.  It draws less juice than my small fan and trailer light bulb.  I've ran the TV for 12 hours plus and still been going strong.  When a battery does start to die the first thing you loose is the sound.  The image itself works fine.Quality: ?/5I've only been using this TV for 50 or so hours so I don't think it's fair to rate the quality yet but I did have an issue with the USB and SD card reader.  Mine didn't work right out of the box.  This happens to be a feature I'll never use so I didn't complain to the seller or worry about it but I thought it only fair to note.The menu is simple and easy to navigate.  Not a lot of options and adjustments for the techy geeks out there but enough to get what you need.Overall a nice little TV that runs on 12v or regular AC with an included adapter.  I have no regrets with the purchase and would recomend it to anybody looking for a TV for their Truck/Van/Camper/Fish house, etc.EDIT on 11/13/12:  TV is still going strong.  We used it on a family road trip in the back of our car (strapped it between the front seats) and the kids loved it.  I also use it in my garage on a regular basis.  TV is still going strong and I still have no regrets on the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Berto
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this TV for our travel trailer and overall we are very happy with the TV.  The picture quality is good and the build in DVD player does exactly what is supposed to do.  Our primary criteria for buying a unit was that it could run on either 12v DV or 110 AC.  There are not too many units on the market that can do both.  The built in TV tuner works great.  I can pull anywhere from 15 to 20 digital off the air tv stations.  Do not get to hung up on the 1080P spec.  The built in DVD player can only output 480 lines of resolution and it's extremely hard to notice any difference in picture quality between 720p and 1080p on any tv less than 42" diagonal anyway.

Reviews.Title: Neat little LED TV
Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: Florida experiences occasional power issues... lightning, hurricanes, and power shortages.  This LED TV works great on 12 V or 110 V; both cables included.  Tuner works fine for cable (analog or digital QAM) and with off air signals.  Just can't connect both at once, have to select which connection is in use in the set up guide.  Has standard search and program menu for finding channels.  Channels can be hidden when stepping through if you desire.In this viewing area, Comcast has moved to digital basic... the channels look much better on this TV than the "free" converter they offer.  Off air sensitivity is very good with external antenna.  Network off air HD signals display crisp and with bright colors.  Black and contrast settings IMHO appear reasonable.  Display surface is matte finish, good for reducing window or lighting glare.An additional nice feature is the built in DVD player.  (not Blu Ray)  Makes this a great office, small bedroom, college dorm, camping or recreational vehicle TV; basically a all-in-one arrangement.Can't comment on longevity yet, but TV doesn't run hot which is always a plus.  Remote is the typical confusing multi button.  But labels are readable and a little practice with the menus solves the confusion.  Manual is crap, sorry.For when you can't find remote, TV does have channel selection, volumne, menu/source and power button centered on top.  :-)Bottom line.. decent TV and good features for the discounted price.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, great value
Reviews.Author: Mike from Golden, CO
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV (as well as a 13") for my motor home and the picture is great.  The audio is amazing for any size TV but for a 22" it's exceptional.

Reviews.Title: Poor customer service for a poor product
Reviews.Author: Lisa33
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these (one 22" and one 19") prior to a summer-long cross country trip with our travel trailer.  The 19" was on the fritz from the beginning.  I called customer service technical support numerous times.  I never got a human and no one returned messages.  Due to the tight timeframe,  I took the 22" TV with us on the 3 month trip.  That TV worked for less than 2 weeks and stopped powering up entirely.  When we finally returned home, and I had the opportunity to sort out the mess,  I was told "too bad, so sad" these only have a 90-day warranty.  Be forewarned.  These are junk.

Reviews.Title: 12 Volt TV
Reviews.Author: Old Timer "Old Timer"
Reviews.Content: This is my second NAXA 12 Volt TV.  I use them in a remote cabin which gets its' power from 12V solar panels.  The first one had a good picture, but only lasted a couple of years.  It apparently had a loose connection which lost the picture.  Smacking it a good one restored the picture for a while. I couldn't get anyone interested in repairing a $300 TV so I eventually had to buy another one.  The new one has a great picture and hasn't lost the picture yet! I appreciate the trend to create a product which uses less electicity and even costs less.  Each set has used less watts and cost less for a larger screen. I hope the trend is also to lasting quality.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for trailers
Reviews.Author: Sita
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for our airstream trailer that is solar powered and have been very happy with the purchase. The picture is sharp and the side DVD player works well and makes a nice compact unit. The sound is okay but a little tinny but this is really not an issue for us. Other than the mediocre sound the TV itself is five stars.

Reviews.Title: Works great in our MotorHome
Reviews.Author: Sharon M
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our class c motorhome, we love that it can run off of 12v so our kids can watch dvd's (with the built in DVD player) while we drive. We removed an older regular TV and mounted this one on a wall so it opened up a whole cabinet for storage. We love it, it has worked great and picks up a lot of over the air station as well. Very happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: David L. Dow
Reviews.Content: My initial impression of the TV wasn't very good as I encountered a jittery picture from the DVD, the sound went off, and the TV shut itself off. As it turns out, the trouble wasn't the TV it was the power system I plugged in to. I contacted the mfg. and they promptly diagnosed the problem as the voltage dropping below 9 volts DC. They were right...Since changing power sources the TV and DVD player have operated well and the picture is clear. Not bad for a 12 volt TV with built-in DVD.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: I chose this TV/DVD after researching and considering many others for my RV. It is perfect! The DVD slot is on the right hand side which makes for very easy DVD changing, the controls are easily located on the top of the unit and all of the cables have there own channel leading to the left so that the unit sits flush against a wall. Having 12 volt and 110 volt capabilities is an excellent feature.And did i mention the picture?? It is superb! Love this little unit....go for it!

Reviews.Title: Nice features but weak speakers
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: Got this 22" version for bedroom in my RV because I wanted a TV I could operate from 12V or 110.  This is a good TV but the speakers are very weak.  Sound is very tinny and not strong enough to hear TV when the RV's A/C is running even when sound it turned up all the way. I will be getting some auxiliary speakers to get better sound. Otherwise, it works great.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Lonnie R Lisenby
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv for my boat and it works great with a very nice quality picture. Would highly recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Naxa 22" LED TV
Reviews.Author: Pam christensen "Mark C."
Reviews.Content: This little TV does a great job in my boat. I'm pressed for space and this is light weight and slim so I can remove the stand when not in use and slip the entire thing into a small closet. It works good on battery power with very little drain. The sound is just marginal though.

Reviews.Title: Ate my dvd
Reviews.Author: Barbie
Reviews.Content: This was the second Naxa Product purchased. The first had the sound board go out in it after less that 2 hours of use. We ordered the 22" and it worked very well with the exception that the volume when you had a DVD in it was very low. We had to hook up external speakers to hear it from 10 feet away. Then it ate the DVD. Unfortunately we didn't use the first TV until a good 2 months after the purchase so as per the warranty we can't return it for refund. It will be sent for repair and we really don't have a use for it. Unfortunately these AC/DC TV's are hard to find at a reasonable price for RV use.

Reviews.Title: DVD player did not work
Reviews.Author: steven russell
Reviews.Content: The DVD player did not work. Discs were ejected without explanation but they worked normally on other DVD players.Needless to say, product not working out of the box is not a good sign for overall quality.Because of a move around the time of delivery I didn't open the box and discover this until 6 weeks afte arrival and Amazon will not accept a return. I will have to deal directly with the company. Will update with how that goes.

Reviews.Title: What a Dud!
Reviews.Author: KndlPWendl
Reviews.Content: We've had this about 4 months (yes, one month past the warranty).  Great picture, but 2 major problems...certain buttons on the remote no longer work (yes, I've changed the batteries) and the DVD player just cuts off when it feels like it and have to start from scratch.This TV is NOT compatible with any universal remote control on the market.  I'd be reasonably OK if I could replace the remote (yes I can buy one from NAXA for the low, low price of $40).  I've learned my lesson, pay a few bucks more for a reputable brand!

Reviews.Title: do not buy NAXA
Reviews.Author: jim c
Reviews.Content: First problem was the from day one  TV  volume was very low you can not hear it 5 ft from the TV and when playing a DVD it is even worse. I installed it in an RV  in Dec and took my first trip in May and did not relaize when the air conditioner is on you can not hear the TV  Second problem was TV would shut off all by itself at any time and had to be restarted. Then some of the channels came in fuzzy with a lot of static and I am on cable. Needless to say that this all happened  on my trip in June just after warranty ran out. Less than 4 hours of use and the tv crapped out. I paid the labor to have it repaired and got it back with the same volume problem and NAXA told me that that is all louder it will go the speakers are small go out and buy speakers to put on it so you can hear the TV. Paid $200.00 for TV, $65.00 to have it repaired  and now have to buy external speakers another $50.00..  I hould have bought a brand name TV. Bought a 15 inch RCA Panasonic for the RV bed room and the  volume is just fine smaller TV with better speakers  you can hear it from 25 ft away if you need to. Sad to say when I read reviews there are others with the same problem. Supplier I got mine from is no longer selling NAXA products due to the poor quality of their TV's

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Winter
Reviews.Content: I have bought the Naxa, a Polaroid branded, and a Skyworth branded combo TV and none have lasted more than a few months before failing, either the DVD would fail to load or eject or the TV would die completely. Have decided that the best solution is to buy a name brand combo TV/DVD from a company like Toshiba and use it with an inverter when only 12v DC is available. The warranty period on all these rebranded TV's is 90 days and then it is not worth the expense to ship it to a service center and have it repaired. Our Polaroid lasted less than a year, the Naxa less than a month and the Skyworth less than a week (even after it was repaired).

Reviews.Title: Breaks after Warranty
Reviews.Author: P. E. Westlake "Pw"
Reviews.Content: Never buy anything from Naxa, ever. Everything they make is designed to break immediately after the warranty expires. It looks nice and plays nice for a while. Then one day it becomes an oversized paperweight. Save the time and aggravation. Spend a few bucks more for something made by a real company.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: R. Peterson "Rick"
Reviews.Content: great tv its 110v or 12v aka ICE HOUSE or camper. the dvd player is good has all the plugs you can think of hdmi usb avi ect alot. also got a $15 wall mount arm supper deal. the shipping was trash took for ever packed very well though. was the longest shipping out of all the amazon things i have got. don't know why? also called amazon 2x and they said my order was sent. then said it was not then said do i want a refund then 2 days later it showed up total time was almost a month. STILL a good TV would get again!!

Reviews.Title: Only draws 1.8A from 12V !!
Reviews.Author: Mark Gehring
Reviews.Content: Used for the last two years in our RV. The super low power compared to 120V models makes this fantastic when you don't have electricity for the RV.

Reviews.Title: This set is a solid 4 1/2 STARS!
Reviews.Author: FireFoot "dktstar"
Reviews.Content: This AC/DC television combo was exactly what I was looking for to use in my RV. The set itself is very light weight, portable and energy efficient (48Watts). The picture quality is very clear and the tuner is very powerful. The DVD player output is only 480p, but it still looks very good. The set has all the popular input types (HDMI VGA A/V Composite USB SD Media). The only thing negative is the weak sound which I assume is because of the small speakers.

Reviews.Title: Nothing better out there !! For any price !!
Reviews.Author: Sherry L. Melville
Reviews.Content: This TV far exceeded any expectations I could have had. We have a camper out in the woodswhere we keep our horses. We are not connected to any shore power, so everything has torun off of house batteries or propane. We keep the batteries charged with a roof mountedsolar panel, so we have to use low power draining appaiances. This TV is a power sipper andit gets a excellant picture on the 30 channels we pulled off of a flat panel indoor antenna. Wewould give this unit 10 starts if possible.

Reviews.Title: GARBAGE
Reviews.Author: bob
Reviews.Content: Do not waste your money on this or any naxa product I bought this 12v tv on sept 3 used it for one short camping trip now it does not work at all I contacted naxa and found that they do not warranty there product now I know why.There products are GARBAGE.

Reviews.Title: Gets the job done
Reviews.Author: Prime CG
Reviews.Content: We needed a wall mountable TV with a built-in DVD player for our exercise room and this worked well. My only issue is the sound quality isn't very good, but it's loud enough to be heard while running on a treadmill.

Reviews.Title: Sound
Reviews.Author: missystover
Reviews.Content: The sound is terrible. You have to turn volume on max. just to hear it. It also has a tinny sound--not clear at all. The longer I have this TV/DVD set the more I hate it. Should have returned. My movies just get half heard because of the sound. If possible I think it's getting worse. BIG MISTAKE--SHOULD HAVE BELIEVED THE OTHER REVIEWS! This product was purchased thru Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: sean
Reviews.Content: As far as the picture quality, this is perfect for my motorhome. Having the tv plus the dvd is great as well as the ability to go from AC to DC. The only reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the speaker. Just like the other reviews you may read, the speaker quality is poor.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have been pleased with the customer service I got with this vendor, as I had a couple of returns.  First one was when the TV arrived yet the cords, and parts were not in their bags making us think that this was a returned TV.  Not trusting returns we asked for a replacement.  It was easy-peasy getting it shipped back and credit issued.  The second time was our mistake when I found my check out had two TV's ordered.  By the time I noticed it the shipment was enroute.  But again, it was easy to get the return label and get the credit issued for the 2nd TV.  Good experience.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: MotoMac
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use in my camper when we're out in the sticks.  It works fine and the CD player has played everything I've put into it.  The only problem is the volume is a bit low, so it's got to be cranked up a fair bit.  The speaker quality is about average.I have not tried it on broadcast TV yet because we're always camped in the mountains and out of TV range.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and it's 12V
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Shipped quick and packaging was great.  This set has a great picture.  It is easily and clearly viewed from angles as well as dead on.  The sound volume is fine unless the DVD or TV program has inferior sound quality, then it can be hard to hear even turn up fully.  I solved this with a small add on speaker I plug into the headphone outlet.The best thing about this set for me and the reason I purchased it is that it will run just fine from a 12V outlet (standard cigarette lighter outlet).  It also has a 120V plug.The built-in DVD player works great as well (12V and 120V).  I only wish it had been offered in BlueRay.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Chanteli
Reviews.Content: Bought this for our 5th Wheel camper.  Works great for what we need it for.  The sound is a little tinny, but for the limited time it gets used, it's not a big deal.  Perfect fit in the camper's limited space.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture. Sound is O.K. looking for some 12 volt external speakers.
Reviews.Author: Steve Reed
Reviews.Content: This T.V. is easy to set up no issues. Picture is clear and sound has to be at 100 max volume and you can hear it fine. Some movies are way louder than others. DVD is easy and the kids change it out w/ no problems. This is great for the kids as your driving down the road. It will start to drain your battery w/ no Gen or driving, so just monitor. Great TV.

Reviews.Title: Exactly What I Expected
Reviews.Author: William N. Phillips
Reviews.Content: I rated this a 4,only because of the sound system which for  a TV this small, is understandable -- it's not the best sound quality; but good enough in my view.Used the TV this weekend in our RV camped at 3600 feet in Big Meadows in Shenandoah Park.  We were there for 4 days and used the TV every night to watch movies -- worked perfectly off the 12v RV system -- power draw seemed very good,as we had plenty of power even thought generator hours were controlled in the park so we did not use the generator when running the TV.  Picture quality is good, but at an angle the color and brightness washed a bit.I would recomend this TV for any application where its necessary to operate off a 12v systems such as a RV, boat, etc..

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Brad Pickett
Reviews.Content: There aren't very many TV's that plug into 9v and have a dvd player like this one.  It uses very little power and has a better than you might expect picture.  The volume is the only issue, if you have other things going on in the room it has to be full volume which sometimes isnt enough.  I would still recommend this TV though.

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: Steve Cilenti
Reviews.Content: Works very well but I find the DVD a little bit to put into the TV.  Also would like to see automatic detection of DVD rather than having to go to Menu.  I've used on both AC and DC and found no problem.  Have not tested to see how much DC draw is on the camper batteries - will be interesting.

Reviews.Title: GOOD TV
Reviews.Author: Jerry Ratts "Jerry"
Reviews.Content: Not as good as a big screen TV but I did not expect that. I can live with it as an extra.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: tdriver
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my truck and would buy another for the house. This naxa was a great purchase. They where much more at the truck stops. Plays great and great picture.

Reviews.Title: Great for Truck Drivers
Reviews.Author: Rick George
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my Semi Truck, before getting a wall mount for it, I just had it sitting on the cabinet, which I forgot about it there three different times, as these trucks rock it did fall off and fall 3 ft to the floor, its still working great, very durable TV. I wouldnt recommend doing this but the quality has impressed me. I also love the HDMI feature since I can plug my Android phone with a 32 GB memory card and watch plenty of movies straight from my phone, also have it hooked to my XBOX

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: Robert Gabe Baker
Reviews.Content: Issues right from the start...very low and unacceptable sound volume, especially when playing DVDs or USB input. Also, the unit turned itself off (to standby)  while viewing TV, DVD or USB input no matter what power input ( 110v AC or 12v DC). Sent to NAXA for warranty service at my expense (both ways) perfectly packaged as new. Returned many weeks later after my follow up calls, poorly packaged. Neither sound or power problem were remedied so I was instructed to send back once again (I pay shipping, they paid return). I requested they replace with new unit and quick turnaround but was ignored. Received back 5 or 6 weeks later very poorly packaged, batteries gone from remote, power issue seems OK and volume level slightly improved however there is still issues with the sound quality out of the earphone connection. All in all my experience has been very poor...8 months, poor customer service and bad quality.

Reviews.Title: Same model numbers - different TV's
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: I ordered two NAXA NTD-2252 22" Widescreen Full 1080p HD-led Television with built in Digital TV Tuner & amp: DVD Player. The TV's were purchased for use in an RV and work fine.I did find it strange that even though they were the same model number about the only things that were common between the two sets was they were both 16:9, HD, 12V and used the same remote. Other than that they were two different TV's. Connection layout, on-screen menus, set up screens and user manuals were completely different.22" Widescreen Full 1080p HD-led Television with built in Digital TV Tuner & amp: DVD Player

Reviews.Title: good pic lousy speakers
Reviews.Author: jesse Mccombs
Reviews.Content: Picture is good. The speakers suck. With them turned up all the way you can stick your head next to them.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV AND DVD COMBO
Reviews.Author: pjones
Reviews.Content: BOUGHT FOR CRUISER TO HAVE FOR TV ON THE LAKE.  WORKS GREAT, HAS A GREAT PICTURE AND THE DVD IS AWESOME.  WE HAVE USED THE DVD ALOT  OTHERS MENTIONED SOUND QUALITY BUT WE THINK THE SOUND IS FINE.  WE HAVE NO PROBLEMS HEARING IT.  A NO BRAINER IF YOU NEED A 12 VOLT FOR A BOAT OR A RV.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, works flawlessly sound is marginal.
Reviews.Author: Paul Alleluia
Reviews.Content: have it in my boat, love it... i am however, going to connect it to my stereo, the volume is marginal.Net Net, glad I bought it... and thinking about buying a second one.

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture
Reviews.Author: KIM
Reviews.Content: This tv has a nice picture and is lightweight.Using in an rvNote-if your battery voltage is too low the volume will go completly out.Thought I had a tv problem because of no volume, but it was the battery voltage.The Audio is pretty thin, purchased an amp on amazon for $20 will install and follow up with a post

Reviews.Title: Right price
Reviews.Author: Donald Dump
Reviews.Content: I needed a dc unit to mount in my RV. The price was right and it works fine. The sound however is horrible. Wide open and you can barely hear it and of very poor quality. But as I said its for my RV and works fine for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Low Power Use
Reviews.Author: Benjamin G Fielder
Reviews.Content: Excellent Picture. Many previous reviewers complained about the sound level. Seems ok overall. I route it through my RV stereo..

Reviews.Title: Great when parked.
Reviews.Author: Trapper "John"
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to this as my last TV was a skyward with the speakers in the back. But even with the speakers in front the sound is very low. OK when truck is off but if truck is running or Co driver is driving have to get right up on it to hear.

Reviews.Title: POOR SPEAKERS
Reviews.Author: Linwood D. Loving "eldee34"
Reviews.Content: SOUND QUALITY VERY POOR SPEAKERS,ONLY COMPLAINT I HAVE,.DOES NOT SHOW WHAT ON CURRENT CHANNEL.WOULD RECOMMEND TO FRIENDS IF THEY DON'T MIND THE SOUND.

Reviews.Title: Naxa TV
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: TV is great for RV or small room, only problem is the volume is really pretty low, if your hearing is weak this won't work for you

Reviews.Title: GOOD PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: GREAT PICTURE . DOES NOT USE NEAR AS MUCH POWER AS ID THOUGHT IT WOULD. I WOULD BUY IT AGAIN

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk!!!
Reviews.Author: Ron H.
Reviews.Content: I have never enjoyed this tv and owned for two years. It's been a piece of junk the whole time I've owned it. First Naxa fixed this TV so you can't program another remote, and the remote that comes with it is junk. Then Naxa positioned all the connections so they are hard to get to. The power supply cord does not seat right because of this so I have to use a piece of tape to keep it connected. What ever you do don't buy a Naxa TV. I could go on like you need to have the antenna just perfect cause it receives very poorly. It's just a piece of junk, don't buy it!

Reviews.Title: Good for our purpose.
Reviews.Author: C. Clark
Reviews.Content: This was purchased for use in our RV.  Has excellent features for the price, including built-in DVD player,USB, Includes DC "cig plug" connector, remote, AC transformer/cord.  Has all the connections one would need...HDMI, VGA, RF, etc.  Built in Plastic tipable stand (looks like 3 screws would remove it), ready for wall-mount (4 female threaded screw holes in back).  Good picture and reasonable sound.  Lots of adjustments available, including Base/treble, surround sound, and AGC (auto gain control).On the negative side: As expected, sound is tinny.  Volume level with DVD is VERY low (a lot of that is due to Hollywood...).  Figuring out how to insert and especially eject a DVD is a challenge, a function that is mentioned in the otherwise good Op Manual NOWHERE.Again, the DVD is also defecient in that it only runs at 480p.  All of this is tolerable for our use which will basically be for watching a DVD in our RV bed like a laptop.  I may also connect it through the RV's sound system and see if that improves things.One other con is it's firmware set-up.  It insists on running a channel scan even though it's hooked up to cable/satellite.  A user should be able to simply set it on channel 3 and go, but the set up forces one to wait a good 15 minutes to scan and...of course...only find channel 3.  A really stupid set-up function.This will work for our purposes but would never buy it for our home unless we were on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: Would be 4 star but for poor quality control
Reviews.Author: Phil Harmonic
Reviews.Content: The TV/DVD functions very well but the HDMI port 1,  USB,  and SD card ports do not.  Since the Other HDMI port (There are 2) works and I don't foresee needing the USB or SD ports,  I'm not returning it as it was a gift.  There are clearly manufacturing quality issues with this product so I won't recommend  it. I would recommend an extended warranty if decide to purchase.

Reviews.Title: I love my RV TV ...
Reviews.Author: Nate
Reviews.Content: This thing is cool...  Plugs right into the cigarette lighter / 12V outlet in my trailer and we get to watch TV in the woods! When I was a kid I always dreamed about watching TV in the woods and now I'm a grown man living the dream... All I need now is a Delorean and I'll be in 12 year old boy heaven. I've connected it to the trailer antenna via coax and it seems to get better reception than other TV's I've used in the past  - - - I went from getting 0 digital channels to 4 or 5 in my driveway. The DVD player is a nice touch and allows for entertainment when no channels are available - and the TV is still pretty slim and light despite the extra gear. I have noticed that the viewing angle on this TV is somewhat narrow...  I was sitting closer to the TV and had to look up at the screen and got the weird "shadow people" effect ... but this was corrected by tilting the TV downward a bit. It isn't surprising that the sound on this is terrible... like the speakers are made from kazoos ... but It's an easy fix - plug it into another audio device - I use the stereo system in the trailer but even a boom box would work. The pros outweight the cons here - it functions as advertised and hasn't failed me yet - I would highly recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for a vacation TV
Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: The picture quality of very good and it was easy to set up in our cabin. We needed a TV with built in DVD player that could also be used "off the grid". We do not have electricity to our vacation cabin and this TV works great. We are considering adding some external speakers as the volume is okay - but not quite loud enough. This is not a fault of the TV - just our personal desires.I would recommend purchasing this TV if it not intended as a main viewing source.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and easy to set-up
Reviews.Author: MO
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV to replace an older analog TV in our RV. It was easy to set up and install. The picture and reception is amazing, even with the antenna down. It's very light-weight and we just hope it holds up with the vibration and movment of our RV.

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Sheree Wilson
Reviews.Content: So far so good, excellant picture and size.  After reading previous reviews I knew not to expect very good sound quality, so I brought my speaker and connection cord to hook up.  Worked great!!!! It is light weight and easy to carry on and off of our sailboat to watch movies at night. Just got it last week so I will update my rating if things go sideways.

Reviews.Title: Color and blacks washout
Reviews.Author: Dave in San Diego
Reviews.Content: For the price its ok, 12v dvd/combo, hard to find, not many choices on the market.  You need to view the picture directly otherwise the color washes out.  It has a tough time with black.  It should be better.

Reviews.Title: Faulty out of box
Reviews.Author: MARK BASLER
Reviews.Content: DVD didn't work, video would not load straight out of box, bla bla bla bla bla bla bla bla zero

Reviews.Title: Great 12 volt tv's
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these units for my ice house and they are great. The tv is clear, the sound is loud, and the DVD works flawlessly. I would recommend them to anyone needing a tv away from home.

Reviews.Title: Satisfaction
Reviews.Author: Patches
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and quick delivery22" Widescreen Full 1080p HD-led Television with built in Digital TV Tuner & amp: DVD Player

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: cat123
Reviews.Content: Only had it set up for a couple days, but seems to be a good deal. Perfect for the kids' room.

Reviews.Title: How Convenient
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: How convenient that when I purchased this that the price dropped a few days later by $18.00. In today's economy that $18.00 might not go too far but I can stretch it pretty far here where I am at (Deployed in a not so pleasant Middle Eastern country)
